definition: if you live a life of crime, sooner or later you'll pay for it
pinyin: chu1 lai2 hun4 chi2 zao3 yao4 huan2 de5

sentences.english: But sooner or later we will return to our emotional set-point.
sentences.chinese: 但是迟早我们会返回到我们的情感点。

sentences.english: If your ideas have merit, sooner or later someone will publish them.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的想法有价值，迟早有人会出版它们的。

sentences.english: There is another version of the pigeonhole principle that comes in handy.
sentences.chinese: 另外一种版本的鸽子洞原理迟早也能碰到。

sentences.english: Therefore, when you begin romancing her, sooner or later she'll start to do the same.
sentences.chinese: 所以，当你开始为她浪漫时，迟早她也会做同样的事。

sentences.english: Those mnemonics sometimes come in handy. All right.
sentences.chinese: 这些记忆术迟早有用，好了。

sentences.english: She swears that she will be avenged on her enemy sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 她发誓迟早要向她的敌人报仇。

sentences.english: And I was sure that, sooner or later, Perot, too, would turn his fire on me.
sentences.chinese: 我也十分清楚，佩罗迟早也会把火力对准我。

sentences.english: People who cannot find time for recreation are obtiged sooner or later to find time for illness.
sentences.chinese: 挤不出时间休息娱乐的人迟早会被迫挤出时间养病。

sentences.english: For me, I'm still a student and sonner or later running about my job.
sentences.chinese: 至于我，还是学生，也是迟早会为了工作奔波。

sentences.english: Sooner or later, the wave will come along and knock down what we have worked so hard to build up.
sentences.chinese: 浪涛迟早会袭来摧毁我们辛勤劳动所建造起来的一切。

sentences.english: He just likes to talk on the phone, you’ll get through sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 他就是喜欢“煲电话粥”，你迟早会打通的。

sentences.english: Sooner or later, they will wring the truth out of the prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 我们迟早是会从囚犯口里逼出真情的。

sentences.english: Sooner or later the US Treasury and the Fed had to draw the line and the financial sector will eventually be healthier as a result.
sentences.chinese: 美联储和财政部迟早会出手，最终金融机构也会康复。

sentences.english: I'll get even with you sonner or later.
sentences.chinese: 跟你这笔帐我迟早会要回来的。

sentences.english: Yet the details of her skeleton proclaim her human affinity.
sentences.chinese: 骨骼细节迟早会证明她与人类的密切关系。

sentences.english: And, sooner or later, spending will have to be restrained to reduce the balance of payments deficit.
sentences.chinese: 同时，迟早的事情，消费将受到抑止以减少支付亏损。

definition: most likely/mostly (in 8 or 9 cases out of 10)/vast majority
to be bound to/to be sure to
when the moment comes/at that time
hard to say/can't guarantee/difficult to protect/difficult to preserve
whatever the case/in any event/no matter what/by all possible means
more likely than not/quite possible/on the cards
